titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller, John D. 3rd papers, Associates, Datus C. Smith Jr. papers
A Guide to the John D. Rockefeller 3rd papers, Associates, Datus C. Smith Jr. papers FA784

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-09-02 19:52:10 -0400.

did.unittitle: John D. Rockefeller 3rd papers, Associates, Datus C. Smith Jr. papers

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Datus C. Smith Jr. was directly involved with a broad scope of organizations that John D. Rockefeller 3rd either founded or actively participated in such as the Asia Society and the Japan Society. He also assisted in the formulation and development of Mr. Rockefeller's activities in support the role of philanthropy in U.S. society (Peterson and Filer Commissions). Additionally, Smith also led the JDR 3rd Fund's Asian Cultural Program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: correspondence, brochures and pamphlets, minutes, and newspaper articles.
